title: MS NOW - Wikipedia
snippet: In 2025, with Comcast preparing to divest most of NBCUniversal's cable networks as the new company Versant in 2026, MSNBC separated itself from the NBCUniversal News Group and rebranded as "MS NOW" (a backronym of "My Source [for] News, Opinion, [and the] World") on November 15, 2025, relocating ...

title: MSNOW | Formerly MSNBC, Anchors, Shows, History, & Rachel Maddow | Britannica Money
snippet: It was owned by NBCUniversal, which is a subsidiary of Comcast until 2025. MS NOW is generally considered to be liberal or left-leaning. In November 2025, the network changed its name to MS NOW to reflect its separation from NBC.

title: MSNBC is becoming MS NOW. What to know about the change and how to watch.
snippet: It's a new dawn for MSNBC, which ... its current parent company, Comcast NBCUniversal, and moves to Versant, an independent publicly traded media company....

title: MSNBC Makes The Shift To MS NOW As Part Of Split From Comcast
snippet: The website has changed as well, to MS.NOW, with MSNBC.com redirecting to that page. MSNBC was launched in 1996 as a partnership between NBC News and Microsoft. With an initial focus on internet connectivity, the network eventually transformed into a channel offering a mix of news and opinion, and Microsoft eventually sold its stake but the name remained.
